normalised: Lights, Camera, Festival! The entertainment world is buzzing with film festival fever! From Cannes to Kolkata, celluloid celebrations are popping up everywhere. Word on the street is that several independent Indian films are making waves at international festivals. Director Priya Sharma's debut film, "The Mango Tree," reportedly received a standing ovation at the recent Busan International Film Festival. Back home, preparations are in full swing for the Chennai International Film Festival scheduled for December fifteenth to twenty second. Organizers promise a delightful mix of international cinema and regional Tamil films. And, let's not forget the delicious food! Many festivals are incorporating food stalls showcasing local cuisine – think steaming hot biryani after a late-night screening! Who says you can't enjoy a good movie and a good meal? Speaking of regional flavors, whispers suggest that the upcoming Onam celebrations will be interwoven with film screenings and cultural events across Kerala. Get ready for a visual and cultural feast! The festival circuit seems to be growing bigger and better, offering platforms to both established and budding filmmakers. So grab your popcorn and keep an eye out for a film festival near you!
